Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: The part-time online bachelor’s degree Accounting & Controlling imparts in-depth knowledge that allows graduates to successfully hold a department and project management function as an accountant or controller. Graduates will have a variety of career options. As a graduate you are not restricted to a specific industry or company size. Rather, your acquired skills are also in demand across the non-profit sector, from small and medium-sized to large capital market-oriented companies.The video lectures, live tutorials and our study app allow you to study when and where you want. You can sit your written examinations at one of our 12 examination locations across Germany.The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree awarded by Wismar University of Applied Sciences is nationally and internationally recognised. You will gain an academic degree that underlines your commitment to personal development and can lead to a master’s degree.

overview_info.Subject:
Das Business Administration gehört zum Studienbereiche Economic Sciences der Fächergruppe Economic Sciences, Law.Weitere Informationen zum Studienbereich Economic Sciences.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Economic Sciences, Law.
                                                Business Administration

Target group:
The Master's course is aimed at graduates in Economics or a related subject.

Recent observations clearly underline the need of high-quality education, combining analytical skills in financial risk management with professional knowledge in internal and external accounting. Therefore, this Master program rests on two pillars, Accounting and Finance, featuring an integrated analytical approach to graduate education in these fields.

The M. Sc. in Accounting and Finance is designed as a 3-semester program, taught according to the European Credit Transfer System. Successful completion requires students to achieve a total of 90 ECTS credits. The curriculum includes both courses in Accounting and Finance. Compulsory courses are designed to teach important foundations, while field courses allow students to specialize according to their individual interests and abilities. Some of the courses are taught in English. Successful completion of the program also requires a master thesis (24 ECTS credits), written in the third and final term.

overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Numerical Methods in Acoustics, Technical Acoustics, Structure-Borne Sound and Vibration, Architectural Acoustics, Vehicle Acoustics, Psychoacoustics, Noise Control, Machine Acoustics, Aeroacoustics, Acoustic Measurement Technology

Target group: The course is aimed at those who are interested in the field of acoustics and who want to obtain a practical, solid and career-integrated education. In particular, engineers with acoustics-related tasks from disciplines such as mechanical engineering, vehicle and engine technology, aerospace and aeronautics engineering, electrical engineering as well as construction and environmental engineering are among the main target groups of the course. Those with a first degree from other engineering and natural sciences can also continue their studies in order to expand or change their field of activity.

overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Film Acting and Directing, Filming

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Degree in Acting and Staging - contentThe focus of the degree course in Acting and Staging is on the development of a media personality in the age of digital pictures. For the first time in Germany and Europe, a degree program combines the training for the performance in front of and behind the camera and for the mediation of film. Film acting and directing are not seen separately, but are taught as one unit in this course. Reflecting and conveying cinematic content form further focal points of the degree program. The basis for the two specialisations of film acting and directing and film formation is a broad artistic and scientific degree with alternating practical and theoretical modules.

                                                Private Law, Civil Law
overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Inheritance Law,  Family Law, Company Law, Commercial Law,  Insolvency Law, Criminal Law, Enforcement Law, Civil Law,  Civil Procedure Law, Land Law, Law of Costs

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Students are recruited as Rechtspflegeanwärter (judicial officer on revocation) in the respective judicial service of the states of Berlin, Brandenburg or Saxony-Anhalt and receive remuneration under civil service regulations.The training to become a judicial officer takes place in a three-year dual study. The theoretical basics are taught jointly for all states at the Berlin University of Economics and Law (Campus Lichtenberg). These alternate with several months of practice, which take place at the local and regional courts and the public prosecutor's offices of the respective hiring authority. After successful completion of the preparatory service, the career examination will be taken. In addition, a diploma thesis can be prepared to obtain the academic degree of "Diplom-Rechtspfleger (FH)" or "Diplom-Rechtspflegerin (FH)".
